c74object.name: bach.period
c74object.digest: Find the period of an llll
c74object.description: Finds the minimal period of an incoming llll, i.e. the shortest llll which, if repeated, yields the original llll.

outlet.digest: The period of the incoming llll
The length of the period of the incoming llll

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the period of the most received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the first inlet will trigger the calculation of its period. The period will be output from the first outlet, right after that its length has been output from the second one. For instance, the llll a b c a b c a b c a b c has period a b c, having length 3; similarly, the llll 91 8 2 4 has period 91 8 2 4 having length 4 (also, one can say that it is non-periodic).

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
